intro: Schizoglossum peglerae, commonly known as the Antarctic pearlwort, is a flowering plant native to the extreme environments of Antarctica and the Southern Ocean islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom during the brief summer months. Its leaves are succulent, helping to retain moisture in the arid and cold environment. Schizoglossum peglerae is a rare example of plant life thriving in one of the most extreme habitats on Earth.
